Copy and paste the following code and save it to a file named remove_etc_env.shappliedProxyPatchMessage="#System Proxies are disabled to ensure the controller can communicate with internal service brokers" nodes=(`kato node list | grep -v -E "mssql|windea" | cut -d' ' -f 1`) for node in "${nodes[@]}" do : ssh stackato@$node /bin/bash << EOF if ! grep -q "${appliedProxyPatchMessage}" /etc/environment; then sudo sed -e '/_proxy/I s/^#*/#/' -i /etc/environment && sudo sed -i "/#HTTP_PROXY/i ${appliedProxyPatchMessage}" /etc/environment fi EOF
if [[ $? != 0 ]] ; then echo "unable to remove existing proxy settings. exiting" exit 1 fi done
If prompted to allow SSH to a new machine, select "Y".
Reboot the core node. sudo reboot
After the core node comes back up, the issue should be resolved. You can now successfully add the service or the degraded state should be fixed.
